title: Find Your Lunch Table: Which Champs Are Friends?

replies.body: Why don't I see {{champion:119}} connected to {{champion:119}} and {{champion:119}} ?
{{champion:119}}  actually has a 1.0 correlation with {{champion:119}} , which is the highest correlation _in the world_.
I hate to say it but you're missing the fact that{{champion:119}} is dating{{champion:119}}  at the moment
Not {{champion:119}} , {{champion:119}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:119}} {{champion:119}} .
But what about {{champion:119}}?

Why is my {{champion:161}} so lonely :(

Is he the loneliest? He only has 5 connections... I couldn't find anyone with a lower number.

EDIT: Poor Kennen!
that feel when {{champion:32}} is more popular than you... {{item:3070}}{{champion:161}}
It'actually {{champion:85}}  who has the lowest connections, just look

Indeed, {{champion:85}} only has one connection and it's {{champion:150}}.

Poor Kennen :(
{{champion:150}} is just that nice kid who seeks out the loneliest person he can, and decides that they're friends.

but he DOES get to chill with the best champ in the game...
#justgnarmainthings
As a former gnar main, I agree with this.
Kennen only connected to Gnar LOL
Kennen :(
Interesting to see all of the links. Though, I was expecting to see actual friendship links lore-wise.

I was REALLY hoping we would find a good lore one & there were a couple that made some sense, but they all seemed like a stretch in the end. I remember when we first ran the data it was for NA only, and I think Caitlyn/Jinx had a correlation with Vi, but that went away when we ran the global data :(

There is some! I checked a few and one of the biggest stretches (as it relates to likelihood of a player playing one then moving to the other) is Draven to Darius. Mechanically very different characters all together, but if someone wanted to have the Noxian Brothers in their collection, they did it.
That's a pretty good one, bonus points for them being totally different roles

[...] considered very difficult to master or have high skill ceilings. Riven, Fizz, Lee Sin, Ekko, Rengar, Yasuo, and Zed 

Did u just say that Fizz was difficult to master Rito?

Fizz is actually Riot hearing people complain how unfair it was that Vlad could pool to take himself out of the game when he was launched, saying "How can we make people stop complaining about Vlad? I know! Let's make a champion who takes himself out of the game while vaulting fast enough to also chase down fleeing opponent, high enough bounce over most walls, inflicting a massive AOE slow, and dealing a metric buttload of damage (which is 3.28x more than an imperial buttload, for the Americans out there), that also scales and stacks out the wazoo." And Riot would then tent their fingers and curl their moustaches as they laugh maniacally, presumably while drowning a kitten in a puddle formed of sick orphan childrens' fresh-squeezed tears, and nobody ever complained about Sanguine Pool again.

These are the only conditions from which an abomination such as Fizz could be created.
Did you know that a "buttload" is about 126 gallons of wine? :p go figure. Gragas would love some of that.
{{champion:105}} is the best & people that play him are cool/good. Under no circumstances should he be depicted as sushi :(

It's a pretty fun game to see how many clicks it takes to get from one champion to another. Mordekaiser to Vayne only takes three. Heimerdinger to Twisted Fate only takes two, even though they're on opposite sides of the "map".
Six Degrees of Teemo?

I actually went through and [compiled a list.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/memes/GYBJA3eG-6-degrees-of-teemo-main) The furthest champion from Teemo is Kennen, with 4 degrees of separation.

"DUO TO GOLD V 0LP STARTER PACK"

...Damn. That one hit a bit close to home.
If it helps, I totally live there this season & resorted to spamming {{champion:16}} trying to climb...
but when you spam {{champion:16}} and your team expects your ult to be up every 30 seconds {{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
Why isn't {{champion:86}} in the /all OUTPLAYED group?

So my page on League has 95,303 mastery points with Kennen at 6 Masteries, 34,903 with Gnar at 5 Masteries, and the next best thing is Goat Lady at 8,855. So I got here, went straight for Kennen because he's my absolute favorite. Only connection was Gnar. This made my day. {{champion:150}} and {{champion:85}} ftw! :3

These are champions that are related in a manner of players, not lore-wise. People who play Kha'zix probably don't enjoy the same play style that Vel'koz is, but Rengar is very similar in feel so they play him a lot as well.
I love the sass of the article ahaha
Sass? Or SALT? :^)
The unpopular table is the "soon to be updated" table isn't it?

That's an interesting point--it makes sense that the less popular champs need more updating love than the popular ones. But from here it looks like the players that play those less-popular champs play the OTHER less-popular champs as well, and might even like the champs BECAUSE they're not used a lot.

I wonder what the data would look like for "mains" of a champ before & after a champ is reworked; are the same people that played old {{champion:78}} now playing new {{champion:78}} or did they switch to champs like {{champion:83}}? It helps me appreciate the work that the champ update team is tasked with--it's a tall order to revamp a champ in a way that doesn't alienate the people that love her.

just wondering, when you made the "unpopular" group, did you adjust for ban rates, because while champs like urgot and yorick are very unpopular, this group also includes champs like malz, vel'koz and swain; who are very popular right now, and probably have close to 90% ban rates

That's a good point--I don't think ban rates were factored in but I was not the resident data expert here :P

Either way--this data was run before the patch that broke Malz, so those champs might not be in the same groupings today.
Why is Irelia considered an AP Mage...?
She isn't, it just happens to be the group she's falling into because people who usually play ap mages play her. It says it in the article.
now THAT is interesting.
And then there is Kennen... At least he has Gnar... {{item:3070}}

This is actually extremely accurate towards me. When I looked up my main on here, which happens to be {{champion:107}} , every champion that I love to play and play regularly, aside from Fizz, popped up. This is actually pretty cool and I can't wait to see what you guys come up next with at Rito.

That's awesome! We had a lot of fun working on this. When anybody here saw the tool for the first time, they just started plugging in their own favorite champs, so it made a lot of sense to include the tool in the post so everyone could play around with it & see whether or not other ______ mains had similar champ pools. Glad you enjoyed it!
Data is fucking beautiful.

BEWARE THE DEPTHS... {{champion:111}}  is the bridge between 4 groups and yet he is even in a data projection lost at sea...

{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}{{item:3070}}{{item:3070}}{{item:3070}}{{item:3070}}
Is this Riot's way of announcing Amumu has finally made some friends? I think so. {{item:3070}}
When {{champion:32}} has more friends than you{{champion:85}} {{item:3070}}

My top 8 champions in mastery are: {{champion:26}}(6) {{champion:25}}(5) {{champion:21}}(5) {{champion:37}}(5) {{champion:43}}(5) {{champion:103}}(5) {{champion:51}}(5) {{champion:83}}(4)
If I put links to {{champion:26}} as the filter, only 2 from that list appear: {{champion:43}} and {{champion:25}}.
However, if I put {{champion:25}} as the filter (she's my highest mastery score at 9k over {{champion:26}}), 6 from the list appear: {{champion:26}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:21}} {{champion:43}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:103}}.
**This leads me to conclude that the correlations are much more stylistic than skill, since I enjoy Morgana more than Zilean and thus play others with higher correlations to her.**

Time to go into role correlations:
I'm a support main, and my top 5 supports are: {{champion:26}}(6) {{champion:25}}(5) (Although, in terms of points, these two are switched) {{champion:37}}(5) {{champion:43}}(5) and {{champion:63}}(4).
Again, going by points rather than mastery, all 5 appear using {{champion:25}} as the filter.

My next most common role is Mid, and things get tricky here because I play some supports mid. However, if I had to list them with that in mind, I think the order would be: {{champion:103}}(5) {{champion:26}}(6) {{champion:30}}(3) {{champion:115}}(3) {{champion:134}}(3)
Using {{champion:103}} as a filter, something odd happens. Only {{champion:134}} appears.

Next is ADC, my top 5 being {{champion:21}}(5) {{champion:51}}(5) {{champion:15}}(3) {{champion:29}}(3) {{champion:22}}(2).
Using {{champion:21}} as the filter, all but {{champion:29}} appear.

Then comes top, which are {{champion:83}}(4) {{champion:6}}(4) {{champion:57}}(2) {{champion:50}}(2) {{champion:36}}(2)
Using {{champion:83}} as the filter, all but {{champion:36}} appear.

Last and certainly least comes Jungle with {{champion:78}}(2) {{champion:14}}(2) {{champion:28}}(2) {{champion:83}}(4) {{champion:48}}(2)
Using  {{champion:78}} as the filter, only one appears: {{champion:48}}
